metadata.title: CVE-2022-36402 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
An integer overflow vulnerability was found in vmwgfx driver indrivers/gpu/vmxgfx/vmxgfx_execbuf.c in GPU component of Linux kernel withdevice file '/dev/dri/renderD128 (or Dxxx)'. This flaw allows a localattacker with a user account on the system to gain privilege, causing adenial of service(DoS).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-36402` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-262-generic - 4.4.0-262.296~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-262-generic - 4.4.0-262.296~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-262-lowlatency - 4.4.0-262.296~14.04.1
